page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF GRID
page.content: {PHYSICAL:}The majority of the area is in the Avon Basin. Higher land can be found in the East where it rises to 25 metres. The land in the South-Western corner is prone to flooding after heavy rains. There is a second river, the River Mude that runs through the centre of the area. There is fertile soil throghout the area. {POLITICAL:}The area has two major roads the A35 and A337,and many minor roads.A multiple track railway runs across the grid from East to West but there are no Railway Stations. The Hampshire/Dorset County Boundary is on the Eastern side of the grid. The main commercial businesses are light engineering, electronic and communication firms. There are a few Superstores and Garden Centres. {LAND USE:}About 50% is Farmland; 40% is housing;the rest is for industry.
